results.title: How Trump Hopes to Use Party Machinery to Retain Control of the G.O.P.
results.abstract: Ronna McDaniel, a close ally of President Trump, wants to remain head of the Republican National Committee, worrying party members who believe the president will try to use the group to keep control of the G.O.P.
results.byline: By Jonathan Martin and Maggie Haberman

multimedia.caption: Ronna McDaniel, President Trump’s handpicked chairwoman of the Republican National Committee, intends to seek re-election to her post.
multimedia.copyright: Pete Marovich for The New York Times

results.title: Duty or Party? For Republicans, a Test of Whether to Enable Trump
results.abstract: In pushing his false claims to the limits and cowing Republicans into acquiescence or silence, President Trump has revealed the fragility of the electoral system — and shaken it.
results.byline: By Jim Rutenberg and Kathleen Gray

multimedia.caption: President Trump at the White House on Friday. The president’s gambit, never realistic to begin with, appears to be growing more futile by the day.

results.title: Trump Using Last Days to Lock In Policies and Make Biden’s Task More Difficult
results.abstract: At a wide range of departments and agencies, Mr. Trump’s political appointees are going to extraordinary lengths to try to prevent Mr. Biden from rolling back the president’s legacy.

multimedia.caption: In some cases, President Trump’s government plans to act just days — or even hours — before President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. is inaugurated in January.
